reviews.review_msg: She is super unclear. Does not give you instructions as to what she wants, but expects certain results. Trying to clarify with her via email was difficult. She does not respond sometimes.

Gaelle is a kind person, but lacks as a professor. Her instructions and expectations were not clear. Her lectures were okay, but sort of hard to follow at times. She comes of, in my opinion, as a lazy person. She doesn't check emails, doesn't respond to people, and is hard to find outside of class. I didn't feel comfortable asking her questions.

Gaelle is clearly a kind woman. However, I did find this class to be disorganized and a bit hard to follow. Also, there is a group project that runs for the whole semester so if you get stuck in a bad group, prepare to hate this class. More clarity on what was expected & organization on Canvas would have helped this class.

I'm surprised to see so many critical reviews of Gaelle, I personally found her to be one of the best instructors in SFU's French department. She is very open to feedback, cares about and respects her students, and genuinely seems to enjoy her job. Her expectations were clear and she was readily available for extra help. I'd take her classes again.

Gaelle is super friendly and approachable, passionate about course material. Her criteria might be confusing at first but if you go talk to herask her for clarification, she is more than willing to explain. You get the effort you put out.  Thanks to her, I learned a new way of looking at cinema. Highly recommended, definitely not a 25 prof!

Gaelle is an extremely empathetic and approachable professor. She certainly does have expectations regarding the quality of work that students hand in, but is more than willing to provide assistance and facilitates and environment in which non-Francophones can contribute to the class.
